name: stripe
description: The Stripe Model Context Protocol server allows you to integrate with Stripe APIs through function calling. This protocol supports various tools to interact with different Stripe services.

examples.title: Create a customer
examples.description: Creates a new customer in Stripe.

examples.title: Retrieve a customer
examples.description: Retrieves details of an existing customer.

examples.title: Create a payment intent
examples.description: Creates a payment intent for processing payments.

examples.title: Create a refund
examples.description: Creates a refund for a charge.

STRIPE_SECRET_KEY.description: Your Stripe secret API key required for authenticating requests to the Stripe API.

tools.name: create_customer
tools.description:
This tool will create a customer in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- name (str): The name of the customer.
- email (str, optional): The email of the customer.

tools.name: list_customers
tools.description:
This tool will fetch a list of Customers from Stripe.

It takes no input.

limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100.

email.description: A case-sensitive filter on the list based on the customer's email field. The value must be a string.

tools.name: create_product
tools.description:
This tool will create a product in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- name (str): The name of the product.
- description (str, optional): The description of the product.

tools.name: list_products
tools.description:
This tool will fetch a list of Products from Stripe.

It takes one optional argument:
- limit (int, optional): The number of products to return.

limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

tools.name: create_price
tools.description:
This tool will create a price in Stripe. If a product has not already been specified, a product should be created first.

It takes three arguments:
- product (str): The ID of the product to create the price for.
- unit_amount (int): The unit amount of the price in cents.
- currency (str): The currency of the price.

product.description: The ID of the product to create the price for.

unit_amount.description: The unit amount of the price in cents.

tools.name: list_prices
tools.description:
This tool will fetch a list of Prices from Stripe.

It takes two arguments.
- product (str, optional): The ID of the product to list prices for.
- limit (int, optional): The number of prices to return.

product.description: The ID of the product to list prices for.

limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

tools.name: create_payment_link
tools.description:
This tool will create a payment link in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- price (str): The ID of the price to create the payment link for.
- quantity (int): The quantity of the product to include in the payment link.

price.description: The ID of the price to create the payment link for.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product to include.

tools.name: create_invoice
tools.description:
This tool will create an invoice in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- customer (str): The ID of the customer to create the invoice for.

- days_until_due (int, optional): The number of days until the invoice is due.

customer.description: The ID of the customer to create the invoice for.

days_until_due.description: The number of days until the invoice is due.

tools.name: create_invoice_item
tools.description:
This tool will create an invoice item in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- customer (str): The ID of the customer to create the invoice item for.

- price (str): The ID of the price to create the invoice item for.
- invoice (str): The ID of the invoice to create the invoice item for.

customer.description: The ID of the customer to create the invoice item for.

price.description: The ID of the price for the item.

invoice.description: The ID of the invoice to create the item for.

tools.name: finalize_invoice
tools.description:
This tool will finalize an invoice in Stripe.

It takes one argument:
- invoice (str): The ID of the invoice to finalize.

invoice.description: The ID of the invoice to finalize.

tools.name: retrieve_balance
tools.description: This tool will retrieve the balance from Stripe. It takes no input.

tools.name: create_refund
tools.description:
This tool will refund a payment intent in Stripe.

It takes three arguments:
- payment_intent (str): The ID of the payment intent to refund.
- amount (int, optional): The amount to refund in cents.
- reason (str, optional): The reason for the refund.

payment_intent.description: The ID of the PaymentIntent to refund.

amount.description: The amount to refund in cents.

tools.name: list_payment_intents
tools.description:
This tool will list payment intents in Stripe.

It takes two arguments:
- customer (str, optional): The ID of the customer to list payment intents for.

- limit (int, optional): The number of payment intents to return.

customer.description: The ID of the customer to list payment intents for.

limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100.

tools.name: search_documentation
tools.description:
This tool will take in a user question about integrating with Stripe in their application, then search and retrieve relevant Stripe documentation to answer the question.

It takes two arguments:
- question (str): The user question to search an answer for in the Stripe documentation.
- language (str, optional): The programming language to search for in the the documentation.

question.description: The user question about integrating with Stripe will be used to search the documentation.

language.description: The programming language to search for in the the documentation.
